intro: Chlorospatha lehmannii, commonly known as the Lehmann's green fern, is a species of flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its finely divided, grass-like leaves and small, inconspicuous yellow flowers that appear in clusters. Native to South Africa, this plant thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and full sun exposure. It is often found in coastal and mountainous regions, where it adapts to harsh environmental conditions. The plant's unique morphology and habitat preferences make it an interesting subject for botanical study.
